01.Name: Make public statement
01.Description: All public statements expressed verbally or in action.

010.Name: Make statement, not specified
010.Description: All public statements expressed verbally or in action, not otherwise specified.

011.Name: Decline comment
011.Description: Explicitly decline or refuse to comment on a situation.

014.Name: Consider policy option
014.Description: Review, reflect upon, or study policy option.

015.Name: Acknowledge or claim responsibility
015.Description: Non-apologetically claim responsibility, admit an error or wrongdoing, or retract a statement without expression of remorse.

016.Name: Reject accusation or deny responsibility
016.Description: Discard or deny accusations or charges.

017.Name: Engage in symbolic act
017.Description: Engage in symbolic activities such as holding vigils, attending funerals, and laying wreath.

019.Name: Express accord
019.Description: Express common understanding, agreement, or accord.

02.Name: Appeal
02.Description: All requests, proposals, suggestions and appeals.

020.Name: Make an appeal or request, not specified
020.Description: All requests, proposals, suggestions and appeals, not otherwise specified.

021.Name: Appeal for material cooperation
021.Description: Make an appeal for, request, or suggest material cooperation, such as appeal for economic, military cooperation, judicial cooperation, and intelligence cooperation.

022.Name: Appeal for diplomatic cooperation
022.Description: Make an appeal for, request, or suggest expansion of diplomatic ties or cooperation.

023.Name: Appeal for material aid
023.Description: Make an appeal for, request, or suggest provision of material assistance, such as appeal for economic aid, military aid, humanitarian aid, and military protection or peacekeeping.

024.Name: Appeal for political reform
024.Description: Make an appeal for, request, or suggest political change, such as appeal for leadership change, policy change, rights, and change in institutions or regime.

025.Name: Appeal to yield
025.Description: Make an appeal for, request, or suggest that target yields or concedes, such as appeal for easing of administrative sanction, easing of political dissent, release of persons or property, easing of economic sanctions or boycott or embargo, allow international involvement, and target to de-escalation of military engagement.

026.Name: Appeal to others to meet or negotiate
026.Description: Propose or suggest meeting, negotiation, or discussion among other parties.

027.Name: Appeal to others to settle dispute
027.Description: Propose or suggest that others reach a settlement, agreement, or resolution of conflict.

028.Name: Appeal to others to engage in or accept mediation
028.Description: Propose or suggest that target mediates or accepts the mediation of others.

03.Name: Express intent to cooperate
03.Description: Offer, promise, agree to, or otherwise indicate willingness or commitment to cooperate.

030.Name: Express intent to cooperate, not specified
030.Description: Offer, promise, agree to, or otherwise indicate willingness or commitment to cooperate, not otherwise specified.

031.Name: Express intent to engage in material cooperation
031.Description: Offer, promise, agree to, or otherwise indicate willingness or commitment to engage in or expand material cooperative exchange, such as express intent to cooperate economically, militarily, on judicial matters, and on intelligence.

032.Name: Express intent to engage in diplomatic cooperation
032.Description: Offer, promise, agree to, or otherwise indicate willingness or commitment to expand diplomatic ties or cooperation.

033.Name: Express intent to provide material aid
033.Description: Offer, promise, agree to, or otherwise indicate willingness or commitment to provide some form of material support, such as express intent to provide economic aid, military aid, humanitarian aid, and military protection or peacekeeping.

034.Name: Express intent to institute political reform
034.Description: Offer, promise, agree to, or otherwise indicate willingness or commitment to institute political change, such as express intent to change leadership, change policy, provide rights, and change institutions or regime.

035.Name: Express intent to yield
035.Description: Offer, promise, agree to, or otherwise indicate willingness or commitment to yield, such as express intent to ease administrative sanctions, ease popular dissent, release persons or property, ease economic sanctions or boycott or embargo, allow international involvement, and de-escalate military engagement.

036.Name: Express intent to meet or negotiate
036.Description: Offer, promise, agree to, or otherwise indicate willingness or commitment to meet, visit, or engage in talks or negotiations.

037.Name: Express intent to settle dispute
037.Description: Offer, promise, agree to, or otherwise indicate willingness or commitment to reach a comprehensive settlement, agreement, or resolution to conflict.

038.Name: Express intent to accept mediation
038.Description: Offer, promise, agree to, or otherwise indicate willingness or commitment to accept mediation.

039.Name: Express intent to mediate
039.Description: Offer, promise, agree to, or otherwise indicate willingness or commitment to play the role of a mediator.

040.Name: Consult, not specified
040.Description: All consultations and meetings, not otherwise specified.

042.Name: Make a visit
042.Description: Travel to another location for a meeting or other event.

043.Name: Host a visit
043.Description: Host or receive a visitor at residence, office or home country.

044.Name: Meet at a third location
044.Description: Meet, come together, gather with others at a neutral location—some place with which none of the attending parties are associated.

045.Name: Engage in mediation
045.Description: Mediate between two or more parties.

05.Name: Engage in diplomatic cooperation
05.Description: Initiate, resume, improve, or expand diplomatic, non-material cooperation or exchange.

050.Name: Engage in diplomatic cooperation, not specified
050.Description: Initiate, resume, improve, or expand diplomatic, non-material cooperation or exchange, not otherwise specified.

051.Name: Praise or endorse
051.Description: Express support for, commend, approve policy, action, or actor.

052.Name: Defend verbally
052.Description: Defend verbally, justify policy, action or actor.

053.Name: Rally support on behalf of
053.Description: Call on other parties to support the target.

054.Name: Grant diplomatic recognition
054.Description: Grant diplomatic recognition, initiate diplomatic relations with a state or a government.

055.Name: Apologize
055.Description: Express regret or remorse for an action or situation.

057.Name: Sign formal agreement
057.Description: Ratify, sign, finalize an agreement, treaty.

06.Name: Engage in material cooperation
06.Description: Initiate, resume, improve, or expand material cooperation or exchange.

060.Name: Engage in material cooperation, not specified
060.Description: Initiate, resume, improve, or expand material cooperation or exchange, not otherwise specified.

061.Name: Cooperate economically
061.Description: Initiate, resume, improve, or expand economic exchange or cooperation.

062.Name: Cooperate militarily
062.Description: Initiate, resume, improve, or expand military exchange or cooperation.

063.Name: Engage in judicial cooperation
063.Description: Initiate, resume, improve, or expand judicial cooperation.

064.Name: Share intelligence or information
064.Description: Provide, share, or exchange intelligence or information.

07.Name: Provide aid
07.Description: All provisions, extension of material aid

070.Name: Provide aid, not specified
070.Description: All provisions, extension of material ai, not otherwise specified.

071.Name: Provide economic aid
071.Description: Extend, provide monetary aid and financial guarantees, grants, gifts and credit.

072.Name: Provide military aid
072.Description: Extend, provide military and police assistance including arms and personnel.

073.Name: Provide humanitarian aid
073.Description: Extend, provide humanitarian aid, mainly in the form of emergency assistance.

074.Name: Provide military protection or peacekeeping
074.Description: Provide peacekeepers or other military forces for protection, extend or expand their mandates.

080.Name: Yield, not specified
080.Description: All yieldings, concessions, not otherwise specified.

081.Name: Ease administrative sanctions
081.Description: Relax or remove all administrative non-force sanctions and penalties, such as ease restrictions on political freedoms, ban on political parties or politicians, curfew, and state of emergency or martial law.

082.Name: Ease political dissent
082.Description: Cancel, suspend, or postpone any (non-war) activity that constitutes political dissent.

083.Name: Accede to requests or demands for political reform
083.Description: Yield by instituting requested political changes, such as accede to demands for change in leadership, change in policy, rights, and change in institutions or regime.

084.Name: Return or release
084.Description: All acts of releasing or returning, such as return, release persons and property.

085.Name: Ease economic sanction or boycott or embargo
085.Description: Lift, relax, or lessen economic sanctions, boycott, embargoes, or penalties.

086.Name: Allow international involvement
086.Description: Allow entry of or intervention by international actors, such as receive deployment of peacekeepers, receive inspectors, and allow for humanitarian access.

087.Name: De-escalate military engagement
087.Description: Concede militarily, stop fighting, or take measures to ease military conflict or tension, such as declare truce or ceasefire, ease military blockade, demobilize armed forces, retreat or surrender militarily.

090.Name: Investigate, not specified
090.Description: All non-covert investigations, not otherwise specified.

091.Name: Investigate crime or corruption
091.Description: Question or inquire criminal (theft, killing, etc) or corruption cases.

092.Name: Investigate human rights abuses
092.Description: Inquire or search into human rights abuses such as rape, torture, targeted assassinations, and violations of basic freedoms.

093.Name: Investigate military action
093.Description: Inquire or search into military activities such as violations of ceasefire, seizures, and invasions.

094.Name: Investigate war crimes
094.Description: Inquire or investigate potential war crimes or look into allegations of war crimes.

100.Name: Demand, not specified
100.Description: All demands and orders, not otherwise specified.

101.Name: Demand material cooperation
101.Description: Require, demand that target engages in some form of material exchange, such as demand economic cooperation, military cooperation, judicial cooperation, and intelligence cooperation.

102.Name: Demand for diplomatic cooperation
102.Description: Require, demand expansion of diplomatic ties or cooperation.

103.Name: Demand material aid
103.Description: Require, demand provision of material assistance, such as demand economic aid, military aid, humanitarian aid, and military protection or peacekeeping.

104.Name: Demand political reform
104.Description: Require, demand political change, such as demand leadership change, policy change, rights, and change in institutions or regime.

105.Name: Demand that target yield
105.Description: Require, demand that target yields or concedes, such as demand easing of administrative sanctions, easing of political dissent, release of persons or property, easing of economic sanctions or boycott or embargo, allow international involvement, and de-escalation of military engagement.

106.Name: Demand meeting or negotiation
106.Description: Require, order party(ies) to meet, negotiate.

107.Name: Demand settling of dispute
107.Description: Order parties to a conflict to reach a settlement, agreement, or resolution of conflict.

108.Name: Demand mediation
108.Description: Require or demand that a third party mediates a conflict or that adversaries accept mediation of another party.

110.Name: Disapprove, not specified
110.Description: Express disapprovals, objections, and complaints, not otherwise specified.

111.Name: Criticize or denounce
111.Description: Condemn, decry a policy or an action; criticize, defame, denigrate responsible parties.

112.Name: Accuse
112.Description: Charge, blame, incriminate for allegations, such as accuse of crime or corruption, human rights abuses, aggression, war crimes, and espionage or treason.

113.Name: Rally opposition against
113.Description: Mobilize other parties against the target.

114.Name: Complain officially
114.Description: Written and institutionalized protests, appeals, and all petition drives and recalls.

115.Name: Bring lawsuit against
115.Description: Sue, file civil or criminal lawsuit at domestic or international courts.

116.Name: Find guilty or liable (legally)
116.Description: Find guilty or liable at a court of law.

120.Name: Reject, not specified
120.Description: All rejections and refusals, not otherwise specified.

121.Name: Reject material cooperation
121.Description: Refuse to engage in or expand material exchange, such as reject economic cooperation, military cooperation, judicial cooperation, and intelligence cooperation.

122.Name: Reject request or demand for material aid
122.Description: Refuse to extend material aid, such as reject request for economic aid, military aid, humanitarian aid, and military protection or peacekeeping.

123.Name: Reject request or demand for political reform
123.Description: Refuse to institute political change, such as reject request to change leadership, change policy, rights, and change in institutions or regime.

124.Name: Refuse to yield
124.Description: Reject requests, refuse, or decline to yield, such as refuse to ease administrative sanction, ease popular dissent, release of persons or property, ease economic sanctions or boycott or embargo, allow international involvement, and de-escalate military engagement.

125.Name: Reject proposal to meet or discuss or negotiate
125.Description: Refuse to meet, discuss, or negotiate.

126.Name: Reject mediation
126.Description: Refuse involvement of mediators or mediation initiatives.

127.Name: Reject plan or agreement to settle dispute
127.Description: Reject a proposal or request for a final, comprehensive settlement, peace proposal, or resolution.

128.Name: Defy norms or law
128.Description: Disobey, challenge, or resist laws or norms.

129.Name: Veto
129.Description: Refuse to assent or formally reject legislative proposal, recommendation, or resolution.

13.Name: Threaten
13.Description: All threats, coercive or forceful warnings with serious potential repercussions.

130.Name: Threaten, not specified
130.Description: All threats, coercive or forceful warnings with serious potential repercussions, not otherwise specified.

131.Name: Threaten non-force
131.Description: All non-force threats, such as threaten to reduce or stop aid, boycott or embargo or sanction, and reduce or break relations.

132.Name: Threaten with administrative sanctions
132.Description: Threaten to impose or expand non-force administrative restrictions and penalties, such as threaten to impose restrictions on political freedoms, ban political parties or politicians, impose curfew, and impose state of emergency or martial law.

133.Name: Threaten political dissent
133.Description: Threaten to mobilize or engage in actions of political dissent such as protest demonstrations, hunger strikes, strikes or boycotts, physical obstructions into buildings or areas, and riots.

134.Name: Threaten to halt negotiations
134.Description: Threaten to break-up or withdraw from discussion, negotiation, or meeting.

136.Name: Threaten to halt international involvement
136.Description: Threaten to reduce or stop international intervention by expelling or withdrawing observers, humanitarian agencies, peacekeepers, etc.

138.Name: Threaten with military force
138.Description: Threaten to use force, such as threaten blockade, occupation, unconventional attack, conventional attack, unconventional mass violence.

139.Name: Give ultimatum
139.Description: Give a final warning, ultimate demand or order.

14.Name: Protest
14.Description: All civilian demonstrations and other collective actions carried out as protests against the target actor.

140.Name: Engage in political dissent, not specified
140.Description: All civilian demonstrations and other collective actions carried out as protests against the target actor, not otherwise specified.

141.Name: Demonstrate or rally
141.Description: Dissent collectively, publicly show negative feelings or opinions; rally, gather to protest a policy, action, or actor(s), such as Demonstrate or rally for leadership change, policy change, rights, and change in institutions or regime.

142.Name: Conduct hunger strike
142.Description: Protest by refusing to eat until certain demands are met, such as conduct hunger strike for leadership change, policy change, rights, and change in institutions or regime.

143.Name: Conduct strike or boycott
143.Description: Protest by refusing to work or cooperate until certain demands are met, such as conduct strike or boycott for leadership change, policy change, rights, and change in institutions or regime.

144.Name: Obstruct passage or block
144.Description: Protest by blocking entry and/or exit into building or area, such as obstruct passage to demand leadership change, policy change, rights, and change in institutions or regime.

145.Name: Protest violently or riot
145.Description: Protest forcefully, in a potentially destructive manner, such as engage in violent protest to demand leadership change, policy change, rights, and change in institutions or regime.

15.Name: Exhibit military posture
15.Description: All military or police moves that fall short of the actual use of force.

150.Name: Exhibit military or police power, not specified
150.Description: All military or police moves that fall short of the actual use of force, not otherwise specified.

152.Name: Increase military alert status
152.Description: Heighten military readiness and caution; be prepared to use force.

154.Name: Mobilize or increase armed forces
154.Description: Increase the number of military personnel and/or weapons.

155.Name: Mobilize or increase cyber-forces
155.Description: Increase the capacity to wage cyber-warfare.

16.Name: Reduce relations
16.Description: All reductions in normal, routine, or cooperative relations.

160.Name: Reduce relations, not specified
160.Description: All reductions in normal, routine, or cooperative relations, not otherwise specified.

161.Name: Reduce or break diplomatic relations
161.Description: Curtail, decrease, break, or terminate diplomatic exchange.

162.Name: Reduce or stop material aid
162.Description: Reductions or terminations of aid, such as reduce or stop economic assistance, military assistance, and humanitarian assistance.

163.Name: Impose embargo or boycott or sanctions
163.Description: Stop or restrict commercial or other material exchange as a form of protest or punishment.

166.Name: Expel or withdraw
166.Description: Terminate the presence of groups or organizations, such as expel or withdraw peacekeepers, inspectors or observers, and aid agencies.

17.Name: Coerce
17.Description: Repression, violence against civilians, or their rights or properties.

170.Name: Coerce, not specified
170.Description: Repression, violence against civilians, or their rights or properties, not otherwise specified.

171.Name: Seize or damage property
171.Description: Use of force against property or violation of property rights, such as confiscate property, and destroy property.

172.Name: Impose administrative sanctions
172.Description: Formal decrees, laws, or policies aimed at curbing the rights of civilians, such as impose restrictions on political freedoms, ban political parties or politicians, impose curfew, and impose state of emergency or martial law.

173.Name: Arrest or detain
173.Description: Legal or extrajudicial arrests, detentions, or imprisonments.

174.Name: Expel or deport individuals
174.Description: Formal removal or expulsion of individuals from territories, typically following legal proceedings.

175.Name: Use repression
175.Description: Actively repress collective actions of dissent by forcing subjugation through crowd control tactics, arrests, etc.

176.Name: Attack cybernetically
176.Description: Illegal or unauthorized attack on computers, networks, or accounts.

18.Name: Assault
18.Description: Use of unconventional forms of violence which do not require high levels of organization or conventional weaponry.

180.Name: Use unconventional violence, not specified
180.Description: Use of unconventional forms of violence which do not require high levels of organization or conventional weaponry, not otherwise specified.

181.Name: Abduct or hijack or take hostage
181.Description: Kidnap, take hostage, hijack, or forcibly seize control of an aircraft, car, bus, ship, etc.

182.Name: Physically assault
182.Description: Attack physical well-being of individuals without the use of weaponry, such as sexually assault, torture, and kill by physical assault.

183.Name: Conduct suicide or car or other non-military bombing
183.Description: The use of explosive devices or improvised explosives outside of military engagements, such as carry out suicide bombing, vehicular bombing, roadside bombing, and location bombing.

184.Name: Use as human shield
184.Description: Use civilians as buffer on the front lines or in other dangerous environments.

185.Name: Attempt to assassinate
185.Description: Attempt but fail to kill politically significant and influential persons.

186.Name: Assassinate
186.Description: Kill politically significant and influential persons.

19.Name: Fight
19.Description: All uses of conventional force and acts of war typically by organized armed groups.

190.Name: Use conventional military force, not specified
190.Description: All uses of conventional force and acts of war typically by organized armed groups, not otherwise specified.

191.Name: Impose blockade or restrict movement
191.Description: Prevent entry into and/or exit from a territory using armed forces.

192.Name: Occupy territory
192.Description: Occupy, seize control of a territory using armed forces.

193.Name: Fight with small arms and light weapons
193.Description: Attack using small arms and light weapons such as rifles, machine-guns, and mortar shells.

194.Name: Fight with artillery and tanks
194.Description: Attack using artillery, tanks, and rocket fire.

195.Name: Employ aerial weapons
195.Description: Attack, bomb from air, such as employ precision-guided aerial munitions and remotely piloted aerial munitions.

196.Name: Violate ceasefire
196.Description: Reinitiate fighting in the midst of a formal or informal ceasefire or truce.

20.Name: Engage in unconventional mass violence
20.Description: All uses of unconventional force that are meant to cause mass destruction, casualties, and suffering.

200.Name: Use massive unconventional force, not specified
200.Description: All uses of unconventional force that are meant to cause mass destruction, casualties, and suffering, not otherwise specified.

201.Name: Engage in mass expulsion
201.Description: Force large groups of people or populations out of some territory.

202.Name: Engage in mass killings
202.Description: Kill a substantial number of people, typically with the intention of ridding a territory of a particular group of people.

203.Name: Engage in ethnic cleansing
203.Description: Use mass expulsions and/or mass killings targeting a specific ethnic group.

204.Name: Use weapons of mass destruction
204.Description: Attack with unconventional weapons that are meant to cause massive destruction and casualties, such as use chemical, biological, or radiological weapons, and detonate nuclear weapons.
